intro: Dortmanna stellarioides, commonly known as the starlike sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically forms dense mats of small, succulent leaves. The plant produces tiny, star-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, arranged in clusters. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it a hardy species suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
